job_title: Radiology Technologist in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: The Per-Diem Rate for Radiology Technologists is the lowest in the region. The department Chief Technologist keeps a stable ponies of per-diems and just a few full timers that keeps every one under management's thumb. If you refuse to work a shift with less than 24 hr notice ONE TIME, you are terminated....no warning, just a surprise postcard in the mail saying you've been terminated.
cons: According to my previous co-workers, since the purchase of Bethesda by Baptist Systems, things have gotten much worse. Baptist has always been a meat-grinder that uses people up - so I suppose the merger of these two corporate monsters is the best evil match ever made in hell.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: Worked little over time and direct supervisor was very reasonable.  He  believed that the work was important but also believed in family values.
cons: Absolutely no training.  Hospital is a heavy Medicaid hospital so it must manage expenses very aggressively, so pay is way below market averages.  Promised a raise that was never implemented over a 5 months span despite multiple promises.  The CFO is the worst person that I have ever worked with in my career and routinely uses intimidation when stressed.  The CFO had her controller in tears every month end close.   CFO is in way over her head and I suspect she will not survive the merger with Baptist longterm.  The sole reason that I left was due to an untenable work environment due to the current CFO.  If your job would require you to work with the CFO...run!!!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: There are some good people there that actually have integrity and care about others.
cons: The pay is not competitive with area hospitals. Management is driven by how to reduce costs and never think about the employees much less patient care. Human Resources is hands down the least collaborative department with little to zero customer service or respect for employees. Everyone dreads having to contact that department because they are met with a defensive attitude and feel like a burden. The executive team makes decisions about things without any perspective. Not once has one of them stepped foot on my unit and shadowed me or my colleagues for a whole day to see the impact of some of their decisions. They don’t understand processes and the amount of time we spend looking for resources or the workarounds because our technology is lacking.

review_title: Beware of the workplace bully that lives in the endoscopy department.
job_title: RN (Endoscopy) in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: The best benefit would be the cafeteria discount.
cons: Since I left in March of 2013, they have hired two other endoscopy nurses and they don't stay.  There are a couple of decent people in the endoscopy department, but the rest are backstabbers.  Of course the bully and the department manager are friends, so nothing ever gets done about this.

job_title: Registered Nurse II in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: There are many kind and gentle souls employed at the institution. Regrettably, few of them are managerial, and those who are have limited power to effect real or lasting change. Baptist Healthcare has acquired the institution and hopefully can save it from its institutionalized bureaucracy and chronic mismanagement.
cons: Physicians are not held accountable at any time for any practice. Employees are routinely punished severely, or terminated, for minor issues, with no reliable recourse. The pay and working conditions are the worst in south Florida. The institution is antiquated, poorly staffed, and stocked with shoddy, broken equipment.

job_title: Systems Analyst in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: I loved my job at Bethesda. I loved the work and the people I worked with. We always helped each other and supported each other.
cons: Leslie Durham. If u leave she takes it personal and if you decide u want to come back she won’t let u. She also does personal grudges. I was suppose to get a bonus. We did a project that we were there all the time to meet the deadline. She made sure everyone got the bonus but me. When u try to meet with her and try to find out what the problem is that she has with u she just says I don’t have a problem.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: The C3s, Nursing Supervisors, HUB worker bees, Floor/Unit Directors/ANMs and the AVP were excellent:  dedicated, conscientious, and always pleasant and professional .    Medical Benefits were decent, and pay was ok.
cons: The management team (director/supervisor) of Care Coordination (a.k.a. C3 and hub management) were a nightmare.  Stay far, far away  from this management team.  They're incompetent, rude, and abusive and shouldn't be in charge of people.   They take delight in humiliating certain employees. There's a long list of their bad behavior and incompetence; and how they keep getting away with it is a mystery.  The short list includes: not answering emails, showing obvious favorites, verbally abusing employees, accusing employees of wrong-doings without a shred of evidence and over-loading employees with work/tasks with unrealistic deadlines.  Their incompetence becomes the employees' problem.  I've witnessed verbal abuse and decisions made on how much they like the employee making the request.  They'll "council" employees in tandem and it becomes a full-fledged bullying session.  It's a nightmare working for this management team.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: Good if you're a nursing student looking for a temporary position and possible promotion after graduation.
cons: They understaff the place to the point where we literally cannot take care of our patients. Nurses are responsible for 6/7 patients and PCAs have anywhere from 14-18, sometimes more. We have frequent falls and complaints since we cannot be precise and give quality care.

review_title: Great staff and working experience for new RN
job_title: Registered Nurse in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: I received great training for my first RN position. The charge nurses and fellow nurses were extremely helpful. Best first experience I could have hoped for out of school.
cons: It's a not for profit hospital so resources, equipment and basic supply items are sometimes in short supply, broken or out dated.

job_title: Medical Technologist in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: If you enjoy the rampant bullying and hostility that is a huge problem in many south Florida workplaces, pick Bethesda Hospital East laboratory.
cons:
Workplace bullying that defies description.....absolutely disgusting. Management don’t do a thing about it. Baptist Hospital has taken them over, but it is unlikely that they ousted 40% of their laboratory staff in order to create a better environment. The bottom line is this: if you are in South Florida and your first language is English, you MUST be very careful where you take a job. In the case of Bethesda Hospital East laboratory, the entire workplace culture is Third World Caribbean. There is no place in the entire country like South Florida. You have been warned. 
This lab can’t seem to keep employees.....there is at least one temp agency/recruiter who refuses to work with them. Too many people have left with nasty stories to tell. If you’ve ever been on vacation to a place in the Caribbean, and been shocked and frightened by what you saw when you left the resort....well, you’ve seen a glimpse of the cultures that have defined south Florida. If you think that people suddenly become professional, tactful, and non vindictive as soon as they enter North America, you are gravely mistaken. If you think that you are ready for the culture of south Florida, you are most likely very mistaken. 
It is of course very sad that many people live hand to mouth in many parts of the world. Very sad. It is understandable that people who spend most waking moments of their lives seeing to it that basic survival needs are met will learn over the course of their lives to be angry and vicious. Don’t make the mistake of believing that people will suddenly “soften up” after being in North America for a few years....they don’t.
